Agreement on Korea-China cooperation signed
articles.content:
Agreement on Korea-China cooperation signed 
    Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- An agreement of the 40th meeting of the DPRK-China border river navigation cooperation committee was signed here on Tuesday.
 Present at the signing ceremony were members of the delegations of the DPRK and Chinese sides to the committee.    
 The agreement was inked by head of the DPRK delegation Ri Nam Jong and head of the Chinese delegation Tian Yugang.

articles.title: U.S. hard line policy toward DPRK assailed
articles.content:
U.S. hard line policy toward DPRK assailed 
    Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Over 200 members of the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Democratic Workers' Party of South Korea held a rally in front of the U.S. military base in Ryongsan, Seoul, on May 26, according to Seoul-based MBC.
 At the rally they said the atmosphere of inter-Korean reconciliation is being distracted by the Bush administration's persistent hardline policy toward the DPRK.    
 Recalling that the U.S. administration recently called for the establishment of "Missile Defense" system and an increase of 20 percent in spending for the upkeep of its troops, the ralliers contended its hardline policy towards the DPRK is hampering inter-Korean dialogue.

Greetings to Croatian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Croatian President 
    Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Stipe Mesic, President of Croatia, on its independence day.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would further develop in the future, the message wished him and the Croatian people great successes in their work for stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK foreign minister meets Danish ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK foreign minister meets Danish ambassador 
    Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK foreign minister Paek Nam Sun today met and conversed with Christoffer Bo Bramsen, Danish ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a farewell visit to him.

articles.title: DPRK-Cuban plan for cultural exchange signed
articles.content:
DPRK-Cuban plan for cultural exchange signed
    Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- A plan for cultural exchange for Juche 90-92 (2001-2003) between the governments of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the Republic of Cuba was signed here today.
 The plan was inked by Hong Son Ok, vice-chairperson of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and Esteban Lobaina Romero, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok meets Romanian party delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok meets Romanian party delegation
    Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, alternate member of the political  bureau and secretary of the central committee of the Workers'Party of Korea, met the delegation of the Greater Romania Party led by Gheorghe Buzatu, vice-president of the senate of Romania from the party, and had a conversation in a friendly atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall, today.
 The head of the delegation said that all buildings built in Korea are the world's first class ones and all this is the result of the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung who devoted his whole life to the people.    
 And he said he came to know well the army-first guidance of leader Kim Jong Il through the visit to Korea, expressing the belief that the Korean people would emerge victorious in the building of a powerful nation under his wise leadership.
